title: IOT message header schema
description: This is the general schema of an IOT message. Any message sent to IOT requires a standard header plus an usecase specific payload.

assetid.description: ID of the asset (data producer), should be unique.

assetname.description: Any asset identifying name, for debugging purposes only. Prinect: [friendlyName]

assetserial.description: Serial number of the asset, e.g. serial number if the press.

assetsoftwareversion.description: Software version of the asset, e.g. Prinect software version.

assettimestamp.description: Timestamp the message has been generated by the asset (may be different than it has been sent, but not later than!). Precision in milliseconds (if available / given from the asset), format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.mmm.

assettype.description: Describes the type of the asset the message concerns, e.g. 'prinect'. (todo: add some enumerations later here)

eventsubtype.description: Add. type information referring the message payload. The eventSubtype needs to be unique within the eventType. (todo: add some enumerations later here)

eventtype.description: Type information referring the message payload. The eventType needs to be unique within the platform.

headerversion.description: This relates to the current header schema / definition, must be set 1 if the message complies this schema version.

sendertype.description: Identifies the type of the controller if there is any.

sendereventuuid.description: Sender generated message uuid (to detect duplicates caused by transport issues).

sendername.description: Any sender identifying name, for debugging purposes only. Prinect: [Prinect Site ID].[Prinect Server Name]

sendersoftwareversion.description: Software version of the sender, e.g. Prinect software version,

sendertimestamp.description: Timestamp the even has been sent by the Controller. Precision in milliseconds, format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.mmm+ZZ

payloadversion.description: Version of the payload to manage payload modifications. Must be incremented for each payload version.

payload.description: Specific payload identified by eventType.eventSubtype.payloadVersion. Dedicated schema requested.
